poem:
### The Art of Half-Arsing

With shirts half-tucked and laces askew,  
we skirt the edges of tidy,  
honorary heroes of the almost-done.  
From piles of unopened mail to dishes  
nudged to the side—somewhere between  
chaos and care lives the modest triumph  
of not-quite-tidying. Celebrate the glory  
in the imperfect, the waiting, the pause.
